meanings.definition: Crees: a member of a North American Indian people living in Quebec and Ontario.
meanings.sent1: The Crees have a rich cultural heritage.
meanings.sent2: I met a Cree at the powwow last weekend.
meanings.sent3: The Crees organized a traditional dance competition.
meanings.sent4: The Crees are the guardians of the ancient traditions.
meanings.sent5: The Cree elder shared stories of the past with the young generation.

meanings.definition: Crees: the Algonquian language of the Crees.
meanings.sent1: Learning Crees helps preserve an important part of their culture.
meanings.sent2: She studied Crees to communicate with her Cree friends.
meanings.sent3: The Crees taught me a few phrases in their language.
meanings.sent4: The sound of Crees being spoken is music to my ears.
meanings.sent5: The Crees use Crees to pass down their history through generations.

meanings.definition: Crees: to make a shrill noise, as a parrot or chicken.
meanings.sent1: The parrot crees loudly in the morning.
meanings.sent2: I heard the chickens crees when I visited the farm.
meanings.sent3: The parrot's crees woke up the entire neighborhood.
meanings.sent4: The sound of the parrot's crees echoed through the jungle.
meanings.sent5: The chicken's crees added a lively soundtrack to the farm.
